  • Overview

Overview

ViLMedic contains reference implementations of state-of-the-art vision and language architectures (referred as “blocks” ) and full solutions for multimodal medical tasks using one or several blocks (referred as “models”).

Blocks and models

Models are full solutions for multimodal medical tasks, usually composed of blocks.

For example, the task of Radiology Report Generation (RRG) encodes an image and outputs a report. Typically, a baseline solution uses two blocks: a CNN and BioMed-RoBERT HuggingFace transformer as decoder.

Documentation of available solutions are available here and their respective python code in vilmedic/models.

Configuration files

All configurations about training, evaluation, models and blocks parameters are stored in YALM file that will be processed with the omegaconf library. Configuration files are stored in the config directory.

A configuration file usually defines the model, dataset, trainor, validator and ensemblor parameters.

Trainor

The Trainor has a few jobs.

  1. It iterates over the dataset and gives the batch to the model.

  2. The model returns a loss and the trainor calls the optimization algorithm.

  3. After an epoch, the Trainor calls the validator and receives the validation loss and metrics.

  4. According to the current evaluation scores, the Trainor can:

    1. Save the current model

    2. Call a LR scheduler

    3. Early-stop the training

All options are defined through the Trainor settings in the config file.

Validator

The Validator performs one epoch of the validation set and compute metrics and scores based on the model’s output.

The Validator is either called by the Trainor or the Ensemblor. The Validator process is the same in both cases except for two differences:

  1. The Ensemblor sends a list of models while the Trainor sends the model being trained

  2. The Ensemblor can send a list of post-processing methods

Scorers

Scorers are methods called by the Validator that outputs a score or a metrics based on the model’s output. Available scorers are found in the vilmedic/scorers directory.
